Inference: Quadruple-signal confirmation of active water incidents
Description: Simultaneous moisture rise, flow anomalies, temperature deviation, and device activation provide the strongest confirmation that an active water incident is occurring.
short rationale: Fully detailed incident with timing/location and activation; high reconstruction risk.

Inference: Distinguishing condensation from thermally driven leaks
Description: Moisture rises at low temperatures without flow anomalies or device activation indicate condensation; matching flow anomalies and device activation confirm actual leaks.
short rationale: Separates condensation vs. leaks using signals; moderate sensitivity.

Inference: Detecting freeze-related seepage before rupture
Description: Sub-freezing temperatures followed by small flow anomalies, gradual moisture rise, and eventual device activation indicate freeze-induced seepage precursors to full rupture.
short rationale: Precursors to rupture with activation timing; incident-specific.

Inference: Classifying burst events vs. slow seepage
Description: High-magnitude flow anomalies with rapid moisture rise and activation indicate bursts, while small anomalies with slow moisture increases and activation delays reflect seepage.
short rationale: Severity/type classification with timing; strong reconstruction potential.

Inference: Detecting overheating-induced failures
Description: High temperatures combined with flow anomalies, moisture spikes, and device activation reveal leaks caused by overheating-related seal or pipe damage.
short rationale: Overheat-related incidents with activation logs; event-specific.

Inference: Identifying non-plumbing moisture sources
Description: Moisture rises at stable or cold temperatures with no flow anomalies or delayed/no device activation suggest humidity ingress, spills, or condensation instead of plumbing leaks.
short rationale: Distinguishes external moisture sources; moderate sensitivity.

Inference: Evaluating device response timing under thermal conditions
Description: If moisture and flow anomalies appear during extreme temperatures but device activation lags, the system is responding too slowly to thermally hazardous incidents.
short rationale: Operational timing gap; moderate incident detail.

Inference: Recognizing thermally masked leak signatures
Description: Cold temperatures dampen flow anomalies; when activation and moisture rise occur despite small flow anomalies, leaks are being masked by thermal effects.
short rationale: Shows masked leaks with activation evidence; incident-specific.

Inference: Thermally corrected severity estimation
Description: Combining flow anomaly magnitude, moisture slope, and temperature deviation yields a more accurate, temperature-aware severity score for water incidents.
short rationale: Per-incident severity with temperature context; detailed reconstruction.

Inference: Identifying micro-leaks through multi-signal subtlety
Description: Small flow anomalies and slow moisture rises that trigger activation under extreme temperatures indicate thermally sensitive micro-leaks.
short rationale: Captures subtle leaks tied to temperature; location/timing sensitive.

Inference: Characterizing multi-stage failure sequences
Description: Temperature drift → flow anomaly → moisture rise → device activation represents a multi-stage thermally influenced failure progression.
short rationale: Multi-stage timeline; strong incident fingerprint.

Inference: Distinguishing appliance discharge from actual leaks
Description: Warm-temperature flow anomalies with no moisture rise but occasional device activation indicate appliance discharge; added moisture rise confirms structural leaks.
short rationale: Attributes events to appliances vs. leaks; some occupancy signal exposure.

Inference: Detecting drainage or backflow issues
Description: Moisture rise without proportional flow anomalies but with device activation suggests drainage or backflow problems rather than supply-side leaks.
short rationale: Identifies drainage/backflow vs. supply; moderate sensitivity.

Inference: Identifying leaks in insulated or enclosed zones
Description: Moisture rise and device activation with weak temperature deviation signal leaks behind insulation or walls where thermal signals are muted.
short rationale: Reveals hidden leak locations; high location specificity.

Inference: Evaluating device effectiveness via moisture decay and flow stabilization
Description: After device activation, fast moisture decay and flow normalization indicate effective mitigation; continued anomalies indicate incomplete control.
short rationale: Mitigation outcome per event; moderate exposure.

Inference: Predicting escalation from early anomaly clusters
Description: Before major leaks, small temperature deviations combined with minor flow anomalies and slight moisture rise may lead to activation, forming an early-warning precursor pattern.
short rationale: Precursor clustering with activation; supports forecasting.

Inference: Locating water ingress paths using gradient and timing
Description: The zone with earliest moisture rise and strongest local temperature deviation during flow anomalies helps infer origin and path of water migration.
short rationale: Pinpoints origin/path via gradients and timing; location-sensitive.

Inference: Assessing insulation quality using temperature–moisture–flow correlation
Description: Incidents occurring only during extreme temperatures with associated moisture and flow changes identify poorly insulated zones.
short rationale: Maps insulation gaps; location/history exposure.

Inference: Detecting intermittent thermally driven leaks
Description: Events that recur only during temperature extremes and generate flow anomalies, moisture spikes, and device activations indicate temperature-dependent intermittent leaks.
short rationale: Recurring temperature-bound leaks with activation logs; incident-specific.

Inference: Identifying cascading multi-zone failures
Description: Flow anomalies in one zone triggering moisture rise and device activation across multiple areas signal cascading multi-zone water failures.
short rationale: Cascade across zones with activation order; high location/timeline sensitivity.

Inference: Triaging event severity using thermal-flow-moisture synergy
Description: Higher severity is indicated when temperature deviation, flow anomalies, and moisture spikes rise sharply and trigger rapid device activation.
short rationale: Severity triage per incident; detailed but technical.

Inference: Understanding moisture propagation under temperature effects
Description: Warm environments cause moisture to spread quickly despite small flow anomalies, while cold environments slow moisture propagation.
short rationale: Analytical behavior with low incident specificity.

Inference: Detecting false device activations
Description: Device activation without moisture rise, temperature deviation, or flow anomalies indicates false triggers from hardware or software faults.
short rationale: Flags false activations; low privacy impact.

Inference: Validating sensor alignment through four-signal consistency
Description: If moisture and temperature signals react but flow anomalies do not appear, flow sensors may be inaccurate; if flow reacts but moisture does not, moisture sensors may be misaligned.
short rationale: Sensor diagnostic; low personal exposure.

Inference: Predicting long-term system vulnerabilities
Description: Repeated four-signal events in the same temperature regimes reveal zones prone to long-term thermal and hydraulic stress, forecasting future failures.
short rationale: Zone-level vulnerability over time; location/history sensitive.
